"This spontaneous consumer report (initial receipt 15-Jan-2015) concerns a 63 year old female patient. The patient had medical history of an allergy to mercury. On 02-Jan-2015, the patient received intramuscular AFLURIA (batch number 'T511708') at 0.5 ml annually. This was the first time the patient received the flu shot. The patient did not receive seasonal influenza vaccine or monovalent 2009 H1N1 vaccine in the past. On 02-Jan-2015, after the injection, the patient experienced redness, swelling, bruising and a hot to touch bump, where the shot was administered. The patient described the bruise as 4 inches in length and 2 inches wide. Later, her arm could not move or rotate and she felt tingling in her hands - both of which caused her difficulties in getting dressed. Two days later, she felt pressure and burning when trying to urinate. Approximately three days later, she had a temperature of 103 degrees Fahrenheit fever. She also experienced a severe headache and nausea and could not eat or drink. This caused her to be dehydrated and she also passed a kidney stone recently. She saw the physician for kidney stone. The patient received treatment with acetaminophen for fever and headaches from the 02-Jan-2015 until 07-Jan-2015 which did not alleviate her symptoms. The patient also received treatment for kidney stones. The outcome was reported as not yet recovered (recovering but not fully recovered), except for the event of arm could not move or rotate and hand tingling which resolved on 07-Jan-2015. Reporter comments: The reporter causality/relatedness was assessed as related. The patient required consultation with a doctor but no admission to hospital to hospital emergency department."

We were working towards bolus feeds along with oral eating via table meals and bottles with their high calorie formula. I went to another licensed medical doctor for a 2nd opinion on January 19, 2015 concerning getting any more vaccines due to their previous documented reactions. After examining each girl and thoroughly going over all the documentation from previous appointments with their PCP, my own documentation and their O/T, he made strong recommendations that it would NOT be in their best interest to get any more vaccines. He then filled out a permanent MEDICAL EXEMPTION form so they would not receive any further vaccines due to their previous adverse reactions that seemed to be getting worse each time they received a vaccination."

It was unknown if the patient had any allergies, birth defects, medical conditions or illness at the time of vaccination. It was reported that on 27-JAN-2015, female patient was vaccinated with the first dose of VARIVAX (Merck) subcutaneously into the left leg, lot number J006358, expiration date 23-MAY-2015 and with the first dose of PROQUAD (Merck) subcutaneously into the right leg, lot number K005644, expiration date 17-OCT-2015. Concomitant therapies included: the second dose of Influenza virus vaccine (manufacturer Sanofi), intramuscularly into the left thigh, lot number was reported as 44983PH, administered on 27-JAN-2015 and the fourth dose of PREVNAR intramuscularly into the right thigh, lot number was reported as J16883 (date of administration was unknown). "Received order to administer HAVRIX and FLUZONE - Administered HAVRIX and in error FLULAVAL. Once I noticed my error I immediately notified ordering physician. She directed me to see a nurse I work with to see what our protocol is. That nurse said she would call someone at the County Health Dept. - which we left a voicemail asking to give a call back asking for me. In meantime, I spoke with pharmacist/representative from GlaxoSmithKline and told them of the situation and what to look for...they stated that they have done studies in which they have given FLULAVAL to children under 3 (6 months to 35 months) - given 1-2 doses depending whether or not that they were primed (if it was their first dose ever, requiring 2 initially or if they have previously received flu vaccine) and have found pain at injection site, loss of appetite, fever, and febrile convulsions. After my phone call with the manufacturing company, I spoke with someone from the Health Department, she stated to notify parents and complete a vaccine error form. She agreed that the reactions to the FLULAVAL when given to those under 3 yrs of age and are the same possible reactions of many other vaccines that we administer. I then discussed with office manager and together we brought it to the attention of Doctor who runs the office. He decided that I call the parents to notify them of what had happened and due to a slightly higher dose that he received to closely observe for any reaction(s). In the early afternoon, I spoke with patient's father and told him of my error. He stated that he believes that pt has had the flu shot in the past and recalls that all he had was a little temperature - I am unsure if that was given in conjunction with any other vaccinations. I told father that when he discusses with his wife who was unavailable at the time she can call to discuss with me if comfortable or with ordering doctor who did exam. I also stated that we (myself or one of the nurses) would follow up with a phone call to see how pt is doing tomorrow to document our note/vaccine error form. He confirmed on the phone that he has the VIS sheet and understands what to look for regarding reactions and that he should be concerned about. Notified ordering physician of my note."

"A patient came into the clinic for PPD tuberculin skin test. After the provider evaluated the patient and ordered the PPD test, the medical assistant (MA) was instructed to give the test to the patient. After the test was given, the patient was discharged by the MA. Within an hour or so, the lead supervising MA noticed a vial of FLUVIRIN sitting out on a desk. The lead MA asked all the other MAs and providers if anyone ordered the FLUVIRIN vaccine and why it was sitting out instead of in the refrigerator. The provider's MA admitted that she accidentally gave FLUVIRIN instead of tuberculin intradermally in the patient's forearm. Multiple attempts were made to contact the patient without success. The incident was reported to the County Dept of Public Health. 48 hours later, the patient returned to the clinic for PPD read and this was when the incident was disclosed to the patient. The patient had a 3cm area of erythema and mild swelling at the injection site where FLUVIRIN was administered. The patient denied any other problems or history of allergies. The PPD was then correctly given in the other forearm."

"This medically confirmed spontaneous report (initial receipt 08-Jan-2015) concerns a 20 year-old male patient who received the flu shot (non-CSL product) in the past without any issues. The patient did not take any concomitant medications, and had no history of febrile reactions to any vaccines, including previous flu shots. He did not receive other recent immunisations.  On 07-Jan-2015, in the evening, the patient received intramuscular AFLURIA (batch number 09949221A) 0.5mL annually. This was the first time he received AFLURIA. On 08-Jan-2015, in the morning, the patient reported that he experienced 102 degrees Fahrenheit (oral) after the AFLURIA administration. The patient believed that AFLURIA caused his fever and that he now has the flu. The patient will see his physician later on 08-Jan-2015 for further assessment. The outcome was reported as unknown. Reporter's comments: The reporter counseled the patient on flu incubation periods and antibody responses, reported that the fever was related to the AFLURIA, and reported that the patient could have received H1N1 vaccine at another pharmacy (there were none listed in the patient's pharmacy profile) at the reporter's pharmacy. Follow-up (16-Jan-2015): Clinical course, AE start date and outcome."

Urgent care did several tests including throat swab for strep test, urinalysis and chest X-ray and could not find a conclusive cause for the fever. "Patient came in yesterday to pick up medication and was counsel to recieve the flu vaccination and pneumo. The patient elected to have both the vaccines however soon after recieving the injection later that night, she felt a burning sensation/swelling and put on a ice pack. This morning she noted that the swelling had gone down but there was a large rash that had been developed on the backside/tricep area of her arm. When speaking with the patient, patient stated that she had already been on Allegra once daily thus we suggested to add Benadryl liq for quicker onset and liberally apply Benadryl/Allegra cream/ung in place of physically scratching the area. The rash could not be determine from the long duration of ice therapy nor itching thus I suggested using  the cream in place of scratching and a towel to buffer the area with the ice with 20 on/off intervals to minimize possible skin irritation. Hydrocort was not suggested since the itching had minimized and if the scratching had lead to a small case of infection - it would proliferate the affected area. Furthermore we ask the patient to follow-up with us the following day to let us know if the skin rash continue to advance and seek urgent care for possible steroid therapy. To mark the development for the rash, we had told the patient to mark around the area and time/date it on the skin before seeing the provider to indicate growth of the rash."

"This case was reported by a consumer via call center representative and described the occurrence of shivering in a 86-year-old female patient who received Influenza vaccine. On 15th September 2015, the patient received Influenza vaccine. On 15th September 2015, 2 hrs after receiving Influenza vaccine, the patient experienced shivering. On an unknown date, the patient experienced fever and tiredness. The patient was treated with ALEVE. On 15th September 2015, the outcome of the shivering was recovered/resolved. On an unknown date, the outcome of the fever was recovered/resolved and the outcome of the tiredness was not recovered/not resolved. It was unknown if the reporter considered the shivering, fever and tiredness to be related to Influenza vaccine. Additional details were provided as follows: Since many years, the patient had received flu vaccines every year and she did not experience any reaction after the vaccination. On 15th September 2015, at 4 pm, the patient received a flu vaccine. On the same day, at 6 pm, the patient started shivering and she was not able to get warm no matter how much she tried and then at 10 pm, it got resolved. The patient was fine. On 16th September 2015, Wednesday, in the evening at about 7 pm i.e. 27 hours after receiving Influenza vaccine, the patient's face started to get so hot that she felt like she was burning. Then, she took her body temperature and it was observed as 100.6 F. The patient had been indoors most of the days. The patient did not remember the last time she had temperature, usually it was 97 or lower. The patient took an ALEVE and went to bed. "About 11 a.m., Saturday, September 19, 2015, I received a ôhigh dose flu shotö for those over 65.  About 45 minutes to one hour later, my head started to hurt.  I didnÆt feel well in general and tried to eat a saltine cracker.  I couldnÆt swallow the cracker.  It felt like something large was stuck in my throat.  I was able to drink water but my throat hurt and I couldnÆt swallow the cracker.  I began to cough and get hoarse. * Saturday mid-day:  My husband called facility and spoke with the nurse there.  He told her he thought I was having a reaction to the flu shot.  She told him that it was too soon for me to be having a reaction to the flu shot û that it would take 12-24 hours before a reaction would happen.  She said I probably just had an allergy and should take an antihistamine.  He asked her if he should bring me back to the clinic but she said not to bring me back.  She said it was too early to do diagnostic tests for the flu. * Saturday early afternoon:  My husband was not satisfied with the response the nurse gave him and called our pharmacist.  Pharmacist told him a reaction to the flu shot would be expected to occur within the first hour after taking the shot.  She was concerned about my throat problems (that swelling in my throat could cause breathing problems). She suggested I take an antihistamine but, if I didnÆt get better, that he should take me to an emergency room.  He went to the pharmacy and brought me Benadryl liquid antihistamine. * Saturday afternoon and night:  When he returned home from the pharmacy, I was feeling much worse.  I took the Benadryl.  He noticed the whites of my eyes had turned red and there was yellow matter in the corners of both eyes.  My neck was stiff and ached.  I began to have hard chills.  I ached all over.  My temperature was 102 degrees.  My throat hurt and it was hard to swallow.  My head hurt more and the chills were so hard I couldnÆt hold a glass to drink water to take ibuprofen û my husband held my glass of water so I could drink water.  After a couple hours, the big lump in my throat shrank a lot and I went to sleep.  I slept restlessly throughout the night.  * Sunday:  We ate breakfast early Sunday morning.  I had to eat soft food because my throat hurt.  My temperature was below normal.  My head hurt, my face and eyes were still swollen and my eyes were red.  I ached but had no chills.  My symptoms improved throughout the day.  I slept restlessly Sunday night.  Monday:  I woke with a headache but the swelling in my eyes and face was not as much.  I was wobbly and weak throughout the day.  By Monday evening, my headache had nearly subsided. Tuesday:  I went outside for the first time and walked about 15 minutes.  Still weak and wobbly but getting stronger. * Wednesday:  I felt stronger and walked outside for nearly an hour.  Symptoms had resolved."

"Low-grade fever: 99.9. Substantial swelling of thigh on left leg, larger than the vaccine admin site. HIVES at vaccine admin site, hives spread over next few days, call doctor on Saturday to ask if can give Benadryl. Hives last a total of 6 days, they respond to the Benadryl, first by just reducing back to only covering the area at the vaccine sites on the thighs, then becoming smaller, then just disappearing. Hoarsness of voice begins at same time, Hoarseness lasts 2 weeks post vaccine admin. Please note: As same vaccines are usually administered at 4 month visit per recommended vaccine administration schedule, spoke with pediatrician about spacing out recommended vaccines e.g. instead of having all 8 vaccines administered at once again... doing one vaccine (or combo vaccine) a week in an attempt to a. identify the one that caused the allergy and/or b. reduce the chance of a repeated allergy by introducing less vaccines at once. Fingers crossed this works to address the problem and we see no further reactions/illness."

"I am copying from an email sent on 9/24/2015 to a local ID expert.  This describes adverse reactions for fall of 2014 and for this year: I have had problems with my left rotator cuff for maybe 5 years.   I take the flu vaccine every year û always had the shot, never the Flumist.  Prior to last year û no problems.  Last year, one of the nurses in the Primary Care Clinic gave me the flu shot û seemed a little high on the arm, hurt like **** going in, and then progressively worsened over about a week.  My shoulder developed impingement symptoms, and I had to see Dr. (got a steroid injection) and eventually had to have several PT sessions to get over this.  Dr's. question was ôWhy did you let someone give you a shot in your bad arm?ö and my response was ôWhy in the world would I let someone give me a shot in my good arm? I am accustomed to my left shoulder hurting.ö He told me to never ever take another shot in my left biceps.  I attributed last yearÆs episode to chronic inflammation in my rotator cuff which was flared up by the flu shot being given in the vicinity.  This year, I followed Dr's. advice and took my flu shot in my right arm û at last weekÆs Medical Staff meeting (9/17).  It was not impressively painful û no worse than any other year.  It was not given high in my arm û I noted where they gave it and would have said something if I thought they were aiming high. No problems û until Monday (9/21) evening when my shoulder started hurting.  Got worse through the night.  Took ibuprofen and probably would have taken a hydrocodone (left over from a root canal several months ago) except that I had to be at work at 6 AM and was afraid I would be in no shape to work due to drug effects.  Used an ice pack during the night to ease the pain.  I took ibuprofen and Tylenol Tuesday to manage the pain during the day and took a hydrocodone at bedtime.  Woke during the night with pretty severe pain but was afraid to take another hydrocodone.  Emailed my PT friend in Sports Medicine û made an appt for today (Dr. in OR yesterday and thus unavailable).  Took hydrocodone (two doses) and ibuprofen through the night.  I could not lift my arm this morning at all û significant impingement problems (this is my right shoulder, where I have had no injury and no previous problems with chronic pain).  I took a steroid injection today in my right shoulder, without an impressive response, so Dr. also gave me an IM Toradol injection.  The pain has dropped from about a 9/10 to maybe a 7/10 this evening, and I can lift my arm about 1/3 of the way up.  This yearÆs pain was much worse than what I recall it being last year, even though I have never had problems with my right shoulder before. This has been excruciating!  It appears to be a delayed inflammatory reaction to the flu vaccine and appears to have happened two years in a row. Note that I am a pediatrician."

I don't know the lot # or manufacturer. This has never happened to me before with any type of vaccine. One thing I did notice is that there was much more dried blood on the bandage when I removed it, than with my other previous vaccine (normally just a speck if any at all). This bandage was almost totally saturated - the site bled quite a bit. As I write this my arm feels better, but still tender and weak. I sought advice from a medical professional at my job who think she may have hit my nerve, and/or the vac. itself actually attacked my muscle tissue. The injection site is still bruised. I still have soreness if I use this arm for anything strenuous (I am right handed so always get vaccinated in my left arm). On the same day the patient was vaccinated with a dose of influenza virus vaccine. Concomitant therapies included ramipril, 5 mg once a day, simvastatin (manufacturer unknown), 20 mg once a day, metoprolol succinate extended release, 50 mg once a day, and aspirin, 81 mg once a day. On 01-OCT-2015, the patient underwent blood work before the vaccinations doses were given to him, but he was not having the results. He had CBC with differential platelet, lipid panel with HDL:LDL ratio, and comprehensive metabolic panel 14. On 02-OCT-2015, the patient experienced at the arm with PNEUMOVAX (manufacturer unknown) shot had a bad reaction to it, it was all red, swollen and spots all over his shoulder on his arm, and he did not feel well. I told her I took LORTAB which has TYLENOL but she did not know what to say as to whether there will be an interaction.  I also asked her whether to take Flu and Pneumonia vaccine together or separately; she did not provide a good response. I decided to take the 2 of them. I had a prescription to receive the over 65 years pneumonia however IÆm not sure whether I received the correct one since when I got home I reviewed the paperwork and it specified it was for the pneumonia vaccine for 65 and under. I called another pharmacy to ask about the interaction between LORTAB/TYLENOL and the vaccines but the staff specified they did not know. At night the pain began I and tried to take deep breaths to help control the pain but it did not work. Did not have problems with the Flu but had problems with the pneumonia vaccine. Patient usually goes to the bathroom often at one but at one point had sharp pain in the left part of the neck but ignored it and went to sleep. 90 minutes later got up to the bathroom and had shooting pain in the whole back all the way to the buttocks. Patient put blanket on and lay flat which helped back a little. I had to take LORTAB by midnight and some more by 6am. Right now still has pain but not as severe. She also had a soft stomach with these issues. At this point not sure when can start taking LORTAB again but is following up with doctor.

MA grabbed the wrong 2 shots from the wrong pocket and gave them to the patient. Painful swallowing so I only was able to eat 2 of the 4 eggs.  I bought protein powder to make a smoothie, which I was able to drink successfully. 10/08/15: Day 8; Woke up and noticed a thick, heavy, white coating on my tongue, which prompted me to go purchase probiotic capsules called Culterelle, of which I took 2. No change in my stools, still black, tarry and loose. 10/09/15: Day 9; Fried up 3 eggs and boiled white rice in the morning. My fever spiked to almost 103 at 3 am. Took more Tylenol. Next day I am feeling very weak with slight fever. Still taking Tylenol. My previous regular flu shots I would sometimes feel chills and get slight fever. This super flu shot made me very sick with a dangerously high fever. I was almost ready to go to the hospital. People should be told that the super flu shot can have very bad side effects. I will not get the super flu shot ever again since this is as bad as having the flu. I might take the regular shot next year.

"This case was reported by a consumer via call center representative and described the occurrence of increased bronchial secretion in a male patient who received ANORO ELLIPTA inhalation powder for chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. Co-suspect products included FLUARIX. Concurrent medical conditions included lung cancer. Concomitant products included FLOVENT, LIPITOR, metoprolol, MVI, oxygen and PLAVIX. On 1st August 2015, the patient started ANORO ELLIPTA (inhaled) 1 puff(s) once daily. In September 2015, the patient received FLUARIX (injection). In September 2015, an unknown time after receiving ANORO ELLIPTA and FLUARIX, the patient experienced increased bronchial secretion, sinus disorder, tachypnea and cold. On an unknown date, the patient experienced productive cough. ANORO ELLIPTA was continued with no change. FLUARIX was continued with no change. On an unknown date, the outcome of the increased bronchial secretion, sinus disorder, tachypnea, cold and productive cough were not recovered/not resolved. The reporter considered the increased bronchial secretion to be related to ANORO ELLIPTA and FLUARIX. The reporter considered the sinus disorder, tachypnea and cold to be possibly related to ANORO ELLIPTA and FLUARIX. It was unknown if the reporter considered the productive cough to be related to ANORO ELLIPTA and FLUARIX. Additional information: This case was received via call center representative on 12 October 2015. Caller reported that he was switched from SPIRIVA to ANORO around the first of August. Around or about the first of September he began to notice increase mucous in his lungs, panting in his breathing, cold and sinus problems. He noted he had also gotten a flu shot by unknown manufacturer at a pharmacy around that first of September also. He made a phone call and spoke to his Internist's nurse who prescribed an antibiotic but after taking that there was no improvement. He then called back and asked for a steroid and after taking that also still no improvement. He will be traveling back to his hometown this Friday and was encouraged to see his physician. He noted the flu shot was the senior dose, but didn't know any other details of the vaccine. He also stated that he does use oxygen when he walks on his treadmill. He stated the mucous makes it feel as if his lungs are full and it rattles when he coughs but he can't cough it out. No further information was reported."
5 cm x 6 cm faint erythema with swelling and mild tenderness. Full strength and normal sensation in both arms.
"Very severe myalgias, tender muscles, skin and generalized fatigue and somnolence. Loss of appetite, bad taste, sore throat (one side), impaired taste and headache with delayed mentation. Felt I was going to die. Had a low grade fever of 100.4. My basal body temp is 97.6."

"Pt call on 10-15-15 said arm was red, hot and swelling, call was about 7:00 pm, was told to try BENADRYL and Ibu and if not better in morning to see a doctor."
"I do not know if this was related to the flu shot but what I will described has never happened to me before.  I became aware of fairly intense discomfort as if my relaxed fit clothes were suddenly extremely tight.  As I walked through the house to change into night clothes in response to this feeling, my upper left arm became intensely itchy.  The shot was administered to my right arm and it showed no reaction throughout this episode.  When I looked at my upper left arm it was very red but there were no hives, just widespread redness.  Then I became aware of itching at the waist, mid and lower back, upper buttocks and the backs of my lower legs.  All these places were quite red and again no hives.  The back of both lower legs had furrows and exhibited edema.  Apparently the legs of my jeans had caused the furrows as the cloth tightened in response to the swelling.  I took a generic Claritin and applied Eucerin Itch Relief cream to all the affected areas.  I took my blood pressure -- it was 148/81, quite high for me, pulse was a normal for me 63.  My temperature was 97.3.  The symptoms gradually resolved over the course of the next hour with the exception of some furrows and edema remaining on the backs of the legs.  My blood pressure returned to normal 118/68.  By morning there were no remaining abnormalities.  I did not seek medical attention.  I have several photos of the skin reaction.  Again I don't know if the vaccine caused this but thought I should report it in case it is of use to anyone."
"Raised bumps around injection site, spread out over upper arm. Has gotten increasingly more itchy and painful."
Patient states that he had pain in his rotator cuff area and thinks that the vaccination was given too high in the arm.
Extreme pain in Left arm and around waist and unable to ambulate without assist several days later.
"This letter is to describe the adverse reaction that I had to my pneumonia vaccine that I received the morning of September 24th 2015. I am a RN and have administered many injections over my 41 years of practice. I knew immediately that when I got both the flu and the pneumonia injections that they were both administered too high in the deltoid muscle and mentioned this to a couple other nurses that I work with immediately after my injections. The flu injection was given in my left arm and the pneumonia injection was given in my right arm. I have never that the pneumonia vaccine before so when it started hurting within a couple hours, I really did not think too much of it. I work in an office setting and was sitting at my desk all day, so there was nothing I did physically with my shoulder that day. I did ask a couple other nurses later that day if anyone had really painful shoulder but no one I spoke with had the pneumonia vaccine. At the same time as the pain in my right shoulder was increasing, I also began to have dental pain in multiple teeth on the right side of my face. Later that evening the pain in my right shoulder got much worse and I could not even undress without help to go to bed. Both the dental pain and the right shoulder became much worse the following day. I happened to have an appointment with my PCP on Friday morning. I asked him if was possible to have a shoulder injury from a vaccination. He had not heard of this and told me to keep my arm moving and use ice or heat which ever felt better. At first I did not relate the dental pain to this injection as I had had a gum graft on 2 of my right top teeth 2 + weeks earlier. The pain from that had pretty much subsided several days earlier. As Friday progressed both the dental and the right shoulder pain became increasingly more severe. I could not move my right arm at all due to the pain. It was about 5 pm on Friday evening that I realized that the injection sire was not sore at all. The right shoulder pain was deep inside my anterior portion of my shoulder where my rotator cuff would be. The pain became so exquisite that around 6 pm I went to the pharmacy and spoke with the pharmacist. He could not explain my pain either. He gave me the PCV13 vaccine form and told me I should file and adverse reaction form."
"Pt. got the flu shot at 1:10 P.M. After 10 to 15 minutes when pharmacist checked on her, pt. is on the floor but conscious. Pt. is clammy and complain of dizziness. Pt vomited. 911 called. Paramedics came and took over. Pt was fine after few minutes."

The reporter was not sure if the symptoms which her mother was experiencing was due to taking BOOSTRIX or FLUZONE. "Tried to exercise as usual by running a four mile distance, but almost immediately discovered that my lungs were unable to process oxygen deeply.  Feeling was similar to extreme altitude sickness, and while I usually can run four miles at a moderate pace without stopping at all, I found that I had to stop every few hundred yards and gasp for breath.  Even going up stairs caused me to be short of breath.  These symptoms worsened until about 09/20/2015, and have very gradually improved since.  However, as of today (six weeks after injection) lung capacity under physical stress/moderate exercise is still no greater than about 90% by approximate feeling of patient, and for now seems to have leveled without recent further improvement.  It is still impossible for me to exercise as I did pre-Prevnar 13 injection without stopping at least four or five times during a four mile run to walk and catch my breath, and even while running there is a constant feeling as though my lungs are not very deeply utilizing oxygen as they should be. It's noted that the Prevnar 13 injection was given at the Pharmacy, about a half hour after receiving a seasonal flu shot, and after discussion between the employee providing the injection and the head pharmacist.  After experiencing symptoms I've read the cautions by the Prevnar 13 manufacturer which appears to warn against doing these at the same time.  Although the Prevnar 13 was suggested by Dr at the same Clinic during an annual physical earlier that day, neither he nor his immediate staff were responsible for actually performing the injections, nor were they in the decision-making process of the advisability to give both the Prevnar 13 and seasonal flu serums at the same time. "Initial unsolicited report received from a consumer on 15 October 2015. This case involves an 81-year-old female patient who was vaccinated with a dose of FLUZONE HD (Batch number, dose, dose in series, expiry date were not reported) via intramuscular route in left deltoid on 06 October 2015. The patient did not have any illness at the time of vaccination or any pre-existing physician diagnosed allergies, birth defects, medical conditions. Concomitant medications were not reported. On 06 October 2015, few seconds (immediately) following the vaccination, the patient had experienced pain in left deltoid. Three days following the vaccination, the patient had severe pain in the left arm that shot up to her neck and to the top of head. She had severe pain in her neck, difficulty swallowing, had a generalized pain and weakness throughout the body. Patient had difficulty getting in and out of bed and felt incapacitated. Laboratory data and corrective treatment were not reported. The patient had not recovered from the events. Upon medical review, the case was considered as serious due to important medical event: having difficulty getting in and out of bed/feels incapacitated. List of documents held by sender: none."

"This medically confirmed spontaneous report (initial receipt 19-Oct-2015) concerns a patient (unknown demographics) who was not pregnant and required a rescue inhaler """"once in a blue moon"""". On 16-Oct-2015, the patient received Afluria (Influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number U55106) 0.5mL via the intramuscular route for the prevention of influenza. On 16-Oct-2015, the patient developed respiratory distress after receiving Afluria. 12 hours after receiving the vaccine, the patient had difficulty breathing and required a PRN (when required) albuterol nebulizer treatment and a rescue inhaler. This treatment helped the patient, in which the symptoms resolved in less than 24 hours. The outcome was recovered. Reporter's Comments: Reporter's comments: The reporter considered the events related to Afluria. Sender's Comments: Company comments: Seriousness: Serious. Medically significant. Listedness: Unlisted. Assessment according to the CCDS for CSL Inactivated Influenza Virus Vaccine and the Afluria PI, respiratory distress is unlisted. Causality: Possible. Time to onset is same day of vaccination. Past history of suspected asthma as patient required inhaler occasionally. Respiratory symptoms responded to and resolved with nebulised bronchodilator within 24 hours is suggestive of asthma exacerbation which is plausible following vaccination.  Influenza vaccination causally attributable due to temporal association and no other triggers specified."""""
"Pt. arm still hurts, keeps up at night and trouble with movement."
"Redness, warmth, swelling to (L) deltoid. Treatment: BENADRYL, steroids f/u if no improvement."
(L) forearm numbness continues 2 weeks after vaccine administration.

"Local reaction.  Red, swollen, warm to touch.  Swelling from injection site to the elbow."

"This medically confirmed spontaneous report (initial receipt 26-Aug-2015) concerns a 63 year-old female patient who had no history of bleeding and was not on any blood thinning medications. "Case number PHEH2015US021921, is an initial spontaneous report from a consumer received on 26 Oct 2015. This report refers to a 38-year-old female patient. Historical conditions were not reported. No concomitant medication was reported. The patient was vaccinated with FLUVIRIN (batch number: 157003) intramuscularly on 19 Oct 2015. On the same day after vaccination, the patient experienced immediate local reactions to heat, swelling and itching at the injection site. On 20 Oct 2015, the patient experienced chest tightness, shortness of breath, dizziness, headache, hot flash, the patient's heart felt heavy and feet were tingly. The patient took BENADRYL. On 21 Oct 2015, the patient blood pressure went up and she went to emergency room after the patient spoke to a nurse. The patient blood pressure was through the roof and it set the alarm off on the machine. On 22 Oct 2015, the patient was pretty much tired and anything the patient did left the patient winded. The patient used Albuterol inhaler to help with tightness. On 23 Oct 2015, the patient had to leave work due to dizziness that lasted for hours. Itching, swelling and redness went away on 24 Oct 2015. The site flared up on 26 Oct 2015. It was reported that over the weekend the patient was still winded and fatigued and outcome of other events was unknown. Seriousness of the events and causality was not reported. Seriousness of the events was upgraded based on information available in the source document."

"The patient is a healthy 44-year-old female who noted localized pain after receipt of influenza vaccine IIV (manufacturer SmithKline lot # 7AJ5J) to her left deltoid. She reports she noted no initial or immediate pain. She reports she noted mild local pain at the injection area the next day. She states she didn't particularly pay attention that approximately 2 weeks later she noted worsening shoulder pain at the subacromion was initially severe enough she left work. She states the pain is continued. It affects ADLs such as dressing. She notes it mostly with extension especially above shoulder level. The pain is currently 2/10. She has been taking ibuprofen or NAPROSYN one to times a day. She did try a topical diclofenac patch which was not effective. She continues her routine exercise program which is ballet dance approximately 5 days per week. She states she likely would not have noted it is related to vaccine receipt except the injection was very high in the deltoid. She has no weakness or restricted ROM. She denies prior injury to her shoulder. She reports she took ibuprofen, likely 400 mg, prior to vaccine receipt to mitigate adverse effects and routinely following the vaccine. She denies immediate reaction after vaccine receipt consistent with IgE allergy including no urticaria, dyspnea, oral facial throat swelling. She denies systemic reaction of fever chills malaise, cough, headache, arthralgias or myalgias. She denies local site reaction of erythema edema, warmth or induration."

"Patient's chief complaint was profound dizziness. She also complained of excessive body heat and feeling """"shaky"""". Vitals showed that she had elevated blood pressure of 143/110 and a pulse of 85. He hands so visible signs of shaking and her face was slightly pale in color. We provided the patient with cold water, a cold compress to apply to her neck, and a small candy bar to help raise her blood sugar. We removed part of her long-sleeved shirt and fanned her with a paper to help cool her down. She refused to lay down on the floor so we instructed her to put her head between her legs to help with blood flow. We kept open communication with the patient about her symptoms and within 20 minutes she stated she was feeling better. Her vitals were rechecked at this time-her blood pressure returned to normal 124/80, but her pulse was still slightly elevated at 80. Her coloring in her face returned to normal and she did not appear to be shaking any longer. She felt comfortable leaving the pharmacy with her husband and stated she felt much better. She went to the restaurant in the store and ate a sub because she stated she had not eaten since early this morning and felt her blood sugar may be low. I called to check on the patient about 6 hours later and she said she still felt a little dizzy and had a headache. She was instructed to follow-up with her primary care physician in the morning if her symptoms persisted and if they became more severe in the night she was to go to the emergency room."""""

Patient got the high dose flu vaccine and she reports within 4 hours of getting the vaccine she was trembling and had diarrhea which resulted in her son calling EMS. They told her she had the flu and she was not transported to the hospital. She reports her symptoms lasted about 3 days. This has not been the first report of these types of symptoms following the high dose flu vaccine this year so wanted to report this to the FDA Medwatch.

"Customer got the Flu shot on 8/25/15. First she felt tingling sensation and then burning at different times: Then gradually developed pain at the site of the injection after 2 weeks. Pain is radiating towards neck, arm and diffusing."
"I had the FLUZONE HD PF 15-16 INJ vaccine (RX #7859429) on 10/31/15. Within 2 to 3 hours I had a large swelling in my throat and also felt swelling in my upper lip. I could also feel something on both sides of my tongue. Next, I developed a severe headache, began to shake violently, felt feverish, and vomited. I did not go to the ER but thought I might need to. It was obviously a reaction to the flu vaccine and I thought I should report it. I was told they were mixing a stronger dose because of my age. I probably will never have another one but wanted someone to know about it."
"I went to pharmacy and received an seasonal influenza shot (lot # 11849211A) and immediately after the needle was withdrawn, my arm went completely cold. It felt like it was cold, and when I said this to the NP, he touched my arm and said that my arm was physically cold. He then had me stay there until the cold feeling left. I have had multiple other flu shots over the years, and this is the first time this has ever happened. As far as I know, I am not allergic to any of the ingredients, or anything for that matter."

"Client states she developed flu-like sx with body aches, fever and soreness of injection site the evening after vaccination. She woke up at 3:00 AM with her right arm throbbing with pain and she has had severe pain ever since. 800 mg of ibuprofen taken every 5-6 hours has slightly alleviated the severity. No swelling, redness to the site or warm to touch has occurred. Client states she was moving arm, massaging it and icing alternating with heat as well with no relief."
"Patient states she feels generally sick, she cannot move her arm sometimes (the one that received the vaccine), her arm is sore sometimes, and she has a cough."

"This medically confirmed spontaneous report (initial receipt: 23-Oct-2015) concerns a 45 year-old female patient who had an episode of atrial fibrillation two years ago. On the 21-Oct-2015, the patient received Afluria (influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number U58508) via the intramuscular route for the protection against the influenza virus. On the 21-Oct-2015, 30 minutes after vaccination ('with' two hours of receiving the vaccine) the patient experienced atrial fibrillation. The patient saw her primary care physician on 22-Oct-2015 and may need cardio conversion next week. The outcome was reported as not yet recovered. Reporter's Comments: N/A. Sender's Comments: Company comments: Seriousness: Serious. Medically significant. Listedness: Unlisted. Assessment according to the CCDS for CSL Inactivated Influenza Virus Vaccine and the Afluria PI, atrial fibrillation is unlisted. Causality: Possible. Time to onset is within 2 hours of vaccination. It is plausible that systemic reaction resulting from vaccination triggered event especially in individual who was pre-disposed. Past history is considered to be significant risk factor specifically for requiring cardioversion."
Arm sore at injection site. Pain progressively worsens and stays for rest of month. Methylprednisolone dose pack 4 mg started 10/26/2015 with no affect. Physical therapy started 11/04/2015 which continues 2/3 times per week.
Vaccination given too far up and to the right of deltoid. Severe arm and shoulder pain lasting for 2 months despite anti-inflammatories and stretching.
"I began to have generalized body aches and lower back pain. Body aches are a normal reaction for me from the vaccine. By 10/31/15 my body aches were gone but back pain remained and increased in intensity. On 11/02/2015 I could hardly walk or rise from sitting to standing. My pain radiated into anterior thighs as well. I iced my back, took ibuprofen and stay in a jacuzzi got tub on and off for the next few days. The back pain is tolerable at this time but has not fully dissipated. I went through events/activities that I had done that could've harmed my back besides the vaccine but could not recall anything."
Patient received a duplicate flu shot at the pharmacy (patient got a flu shot at doctors office).
"Patient reported erythema, and edema of left arm traveling towards her left hand. Treatment by PCP with clindamycin 3x/day for 5 days."

"The patient is a 46 yo female professional emergency room registered nurse with a history of hypothyroidism and cosmetic breast implants in 1998 with revision in 2012, who required drainage of a seroma and removal of a left breast implant with symptoms onset temporarily associated with receipt of employer mandated IIV FLUARIX (lot # 7AJ5J) to her left deltoid. She states the vaccine was given at approximately 10 om on 23 Sept 2015. She states she experienced immediate pain during injection and felt that it was incorrect technique (needle placed against skin then pushed in rather than smooth motion) but appropriate placement in her deltoid. She states the pain is localized to the upper arm, sensitive to pressure and had a continuous ache of sufficient intensity to wake her from sleep. She states the shoulder was not affected and had normal range of motion. She states several days later she noted mild edema to her axilla and her left breast experienced intermittent sharp pains, but denies lymphadenopathy. On October 3 she noted a continuous ache on her left breast and it was slightly hard and erythematous. Within 12 hours she had severe pain and was seen in the emergency room at hospital. Ultrasound was normal and she was treated with KEFLEX and released. She had no fever chills malaise arthralgias or myalgias. She states she had no fever on arrival to ER, but self checked because she felt hot while she was there and registered a temperature of 101.7. In 24 hours she developed erythema on the outer aspect of her left breast and was again seen by her surgeon and received IM ROCEPHIN and prescription for SEPTRA and AUGMENTIN. She was scheduled for surgical exploration and possible I and D on Thursday, October 8. On Tuesday, October 6 she woke with 'angioedema' described as edema to her upper lip and puffiness to her chin and mild pruritus to her lower extremities. She denies urticarial lesions, oral lesions, throat edema, conjunctivitis, rhinorrhea, dyspnea. Wheezing, chest pain cough, nausea, or emesis. She stated had mild anxiety but attributes to concerns for her health. She felt generalized malaise. She was seen in ER and again ultrasound did not demonstrate abnormalities. On Wednesday, October 7 the surgery center performed I and D and reported she had a sterile seroma. The culture was negative,  and the implant was intact but they remove the implant anyway. She reports the surgeon stated he has seen seromas secondary to vaccine receipt."
The injection was too high on the deltoid muscle. The bursa fluid isn't meant to have a flu virus antigen mixed in with it. I may need an MRI to see if my rotator cuff is damaged and physical therapy. (SIRVA).

"I have had four (4) flu shots over the last 35 plus years with three (3) different doctors. Dr who retired Sept. 1994, from family practice was my doctor for 30 years. He passed away recently. He gave me my first two shots, both times I came down almost immediately with the flu. These shots were given years apart because when I came down with the flu the first time, I was hesitant to get another shot. He said it was just a coincidence until I got the flu again. Another Dr moved into his offices. He was my doctor from Sept. 1994 to March 2000, he gave a shot between those years and again I got the flu. Yet another Dr has been my doctor since Jan. 2014. I had no medical coverage between the two. He gave me the flu shot Sept. 16, 2015. He was told about the first three (3) shots. This was the first time I have received an information sheet. I did have flu symptoms, but not full blown flu. I also got a severe rash/infection at my surgical site for my left hip replacement scar. This procedure was performed July 2014, also sustained severe swelling and hardness of my testicles similar to that of a regulation size soft ball and a rash on my buttocks. I do have a small case of herpes that doesn't affect my testicles or my entire buttock region. I had to take two antibiotics for three weeks to clear these conditions. As it stands now, I know I cannot or will not take any flu shots in the future. Apparently, I am one of a few people who should not receive these shots."

"This medically confirmed health authority report (initial receipt 30-Oct-2015) concerns a 39-year old male patient. Concomitant medication was not reported. The patient had no vaccination history. On 19-Oct-2015, the patient received Afluria 2015/2016 (influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number: '29902') for prophylaxis via unknown route. On 21-Oct-2015, three days after vaccination, the patient developed angina tonsillaris, lasting for unknown. The patient required out-patient treatment.  The patient was treated with phenoxymethylpenicillin potassium and was necessary. The patient was unable to work. The outcome was reported as not recovered. Sender's Comments: Company comments: Seriousness criterion/criteria: Medically significant. Listedness: Unlisted. Assessment according to the CCDS for CSL Inactivated Influenza Virus and the Afluria PI, angina tonsillaris, and impaired work ability are both unlisted. Causality: Possible. Time to onset is 3 days following vaccination. Angina tonsillar is essentially severe inflammation of the tonsils with or without peritonsillar involvement. The cause is usually viral with secondary bacterial infection. It is not known if swabs to confirm bacteria (streptococcus) were performed as patient required treatment with antibiotics. Incidental infection post vaccination is a more likely cause.  However as nasopharyngitis (URTI inflammation) can sometimes following vaccination, it may have predisposed patient to secondary infection, hence vaccination causally attributable."
Redness/ swelling/discomfort in arm/shoulder/neck.

"This health authority report (initial receipt 04-Nov-2015) concerns a  55 year-old male patient who had underlying conditions of coronary heart disease and renal insufficiency. The patient had not been administered with Afluria and Pneumovax 23 on the previous occasions. On 26-Oct-2015, the patient received Afluria 2015/2016 injection (Influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number 0986-29701) for via the subcutaneous route on the left upper arm for prophylactic vaccination. On the same day, the patient also received Pneumovax 23 (pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine, batch number K010280) via the subcutaneous route on the right upper arm for prophylactic vaccination. On 27-Oct-2015, the patient developed fever, headache, pain in limb, feeling sick, infection, swelling arm and sepsis, which lasted for 3 days. The first day after the injection, the patient's temperature was around 40 degrees and 38.5 degrees on the fourth day. The patient had severe feeling of sickness. The patient showed other medically important condition. The diagnosis was confirmed with body temperature (result: 40 degrees Celcius), procalcitonin (result: 1,73 ng/ml), blood sedimentation increased (result: 84 mm per hour). The diagnosis was also confirmed by the following lab tests: 28-Oct-2015: lymphocyte count low (result: 4.3%), neutrophil count increased (result: 86.4%), GFR (glomerular filtration rate) decreased (result: 37 ml/min), blood creatinine increased (result: 1.98 mg/dl), white blood cell increased (result: 29.2 Tsd/l), and C-reactive protein (result: 153 mg/l). 03-Nov-2015: C-reactive protein increased (result: 28.4 mg/l), lymphocyte count normal (result: 25%), blood neutrophils normal (result: 57%), gamma-GT increased (result: 107 U/l), GFR decreased (result: 45ml/min), Blood creatinine increased (result: 1.68 mg/dl), and leukocyte count increased (result: 13.3 Tsd/l). The patient was treated with an antibiotic therapy. The outcome not recovered at the time of reporting. Reporter's Comments: Reporter comments: The regulatory assessed the case as serious (medically significant). The reporter assessed the causality as probably/likely in relation to Afluria and Pneumovax, reported that the adverse drug reaction did not result in hospitalisation, and reported  'suspected bacterial contamination of ampoules'. Sender's Comments: Company comments: Seriousness criterion/criteria: Medically significant. Listedness: Unlisted. Assessment according to the CCDS for CSL Inactivated Influenza Virus and the Afluria PI, sepsis and all other events are unlisted except headache and feeling unwell which are listed. Causality: Possible. Time to onset is next day of vaccination. Patient had history of coronary heart disease and renal insufficiency (cause unspecified). Cellulitis and cellulitis like reaction are known adverse events of CSL IVV and Pneumovax respectively. Pneumovax and Influenza vaccine were administered in opposite arms, however it was not specified whether Influenza or the Pneumovax vaccinated arm was the site/source of sepsis. Fever and investigation support infection (inflammatory markers, procalcitonin, WCC, neutrophils raised). Causality for sepsis and related events is considered possible in relation to both vaccines. Renal impairment (GFR decreased, Blood creatinine increase) may represent baseline values or worsening as a result of sepsis. Similarly raised gamma-GT suggests liver disease and or underlying excess alcohol use, therefore causality for these events is unassessable as baseline value was not provided. Causality for bacterial contamination of vaccine (ampoules) as a source of sepsis is considered unassessable; manufacturing process ensures that vaccine is sterile; however a sterility investigation is required to exclude influenza vaccine as a source of infection. Concomitant administration of both vaccines can cause systemic inflammation. However the events and results of investigations support bacterial infection, therefore bac"

"This medically confirmed spontaneous report (initial receipt 09-Nov-2015) concerns a female patient who had received the flu shot for the past 7 years and had never had a reaction. She did not know if she had received Afluria in the past. On 06-Nov-2015 at 11am, the patient received Afluria vaccine (Influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number 10849211A) 0.5 mL via the intramuscular route for the prevention of influenza. On 06-Nov-2015 at 8pm, the patient began shaking uncontrollably and her mouth felt sore and swollen. She also had garbled speech, the temperature was above 103 degrees Fahrenheit, tongue swelling, very irritable, and was not feeling well. The shaking was severe. The patient had strange dreams, which was out of the ordinary for her. The patient was scared and described the experience as frightening. She thought she was having a stroke. She had visited the emergency room and had an IV (intravenous) in her.  When she was asked about her diet, she reported that she had not tried anything new. The hospital did an EKG (electrocardiogram) and reported that she had an unspecified fever, dehydration and an upper respiratory infection. She may had a viral infection. Yesterday was the first time she felt 100% better. About 2 days ago, she started feeling nausea but she attributed this to not eating because she was feeling exhausted. She will follow-up with her primary care doctor on 13-Nov-2015. The outcome was recovering. Reporter's Comments: Reporter comments: The hospital would not say if the reaction was due to the Afluria. Sender's Comments: Company comments: Seriousness criterion/criteria: Medically significant. Listedness: Unlisted. Assessment according to the CCDS for CSL Inactivated Influenza Virus vaccine and the Afluria PI, upper respiratory tract infection and all other events are unlisted. Fever, malaise and nausea are listed. Causality: Possible. Time to onset is same day of vaccination. Event onset on same day is suggestive of combination of systemic events (fever, malaise), autonomic reaction (shaking) and or hypersensitivity (tongue swelling, sore swollen mouth). Dehydration may have resulted from inadequate intake due to other symptoms; collectively all events are causally attributable to vaccination due to temporal association. Neurological event (stroke) is considered to be suspected and not confirmed diagnosis, hence causality unassessable."

On 07-Oct-2015, the patient received intramuscular Afluria 2015/2016 (influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number 098629401) for prophylactic vaccination. "This medically confirmed health authority report (initial receipt 18-Nov-2015) concerns a 76 year-old female patient. On 05-Nov-2015, the patient received Afluria 2015/2016 (Influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number 098629902) on the left upper arm for prophylactic vaccination. On 05-Nov-2015, 1 day after the vaccination, the patient developed gastroenteritis, chills and rheumatoid flare-up, which lasted for 7 days. Infectious gastroenteritis was excluded. Outpatient treatment was required. The outcome was recovered on 11-Nov-2015. Reporter's Comments: N/A. Sender's Comments: Company comments: Seriousness criterion/criteria: Medically significant. Listedness: Unlisted. Assessment according to the CCDS for CSL Inactivated Influenza Virus Vaccine, and the Afluria PI, rheumatoid flare up and gastroenteritis are both unlisted. Chills is listed. Causality: Possible. Time to onset is same day of vaccination. It is not known if patient had prior history of rheumatoid disease or of 'rheumatoid flare-up' was in reference to general aches and pain or myalgia which can follow vaccination. Infection was excluded as a cause of gastroenteritis. Given the patient's advanced age, a concurrent viral illness is plausible cause of events. However vaccination is causally attributable due to temporal association."

"Case number PHEH2015US017995, is an initial spontaneous report received from a physician via sales representative on 10 Sep 2015. This report refers to a 19 year old male patient. Historical condition included asthma, vocal cord dysfunction, acne and vitamin D deficiency all these were well controlled and not active at time of immunization. Concomitant medications were not reported. He was vaccinated with first dose of BEXSERO (batch number: 148901A) at dose of 0.5 ml intramuscularly into left deltoid and FLUARIX (batch number: 7AJ5J) at a dose of 0.5 ml intramuscularly into right deltoid both on 03 Sep 2015 at 2:20 PM. On 08 Sep 2015, after vaccination, the patient experienced some chills, woke with myalgia, tactile fever and no rash. On 10 Sep 2015, the patient experienced paresthesia described as prickly stuff on the chest /abdomen not fingers or toes (prickly pain on his chest and arms that hurts to the touch), sore neck and red left eye/ redness of the eye. Clinical neurological examination shows no imaging, physical exam was normal and he had a good deep tendon reflexes. He was prescribed corticosteroids inhaled but he was not taking. The outcome of the event sore neck was not reported, some chills, woke with myalgia, tactile fever completely recovered by the end of day on 08 Sep 2015, paresthesia described as prickly stuff on the chest /abdomen completely recovered within 2 to 3 days from onset and for other red left eye/ redness of the eye it was reported as condition unchanged. The seriousness of the event tactile fever was not reported and for other events it was reported as non serious. The causality of the events myalgia, chills, paresthesia and red left eye were reported as suspected as related to BEXSERO and for other events it was not reported. Follow up report from the physician received on 26 Oct 2015: added new event (tactile fever), updated suspect products information (date, time, route, and dose), medical history, and outcome of the events (myalgia, chills, paresthesia and tactile fever), changed onset date of event from 07 Sep 2015 to 08 Sep 2015 (myalgia, chills)."

"Initial unsolicited report received from a consumer on 30 November 2015. Illness at time of vaccination was reported as none as per patient and pre-existing physician diagnosed allergies, birth defects, medical conditions reported as some statins. Concomitant medications were not reported. On 07 October 2015, one day following the vaccination, the patient had experienced eye strain, blurred vision, intermittent lightheadedness, headache, fatigue, weakness of both arms. Symptoms were persisted on 30 November 2015. The patient diagnosed with the separation of vitreous from retina. The patient required ER/doctor visit. The patient's laboratory data and corrective treatment was not reported. The patient was not recovered from the events. It was reported that the patient would continue to follow up with eye doctor. It was also reported that he had an appointment with own primary care physician for evaluation of other symptoms. "This case was reported by a nurse via call center representative and described the occurrence of respiratory tract infection viral in a 58-year-old female patient who received Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent. Concomitant products included vitamin B3, vitamin C and XALATAN eye drops. On 15th November 2015, the patient received Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent. In November 2015, several days after receiving Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent, the patient experienced respiratory tract infection viral (serious criteria GSK medically significant) and fatigue. On 15th November 2015, the patient experienced chills and feeling unwell. On 16th November 2015, the patient experienced headache and general body pain. On an unknown date, the outcome of the respiratory tract infection viral, chills, feeling unwell, fatigue, headache and general body pain were recovered/resolved. The reporter considered the respiratory tract infection viral, chills, feeling unwell, fatigue, headache and general body pain to be almost certainly related to Influenza vaccine Quadrivalent. Additional details were provided as follows: The exact flu vaccine was not known. The reporter only knew that it was Quadrivalent. On 15th November 2015, she received the vaccine at 8:30 pm and within 30 minutes she felt the chills. It felt like she was getting sick. She woke up the next day with headache and body aches that lasted for a few days. The respiratory infection presented a few days later following those symptoms. "At 3 AM on 12/19/15 I woke up with numb/tingling and cold feet, a temperature of 102.9, generalized body aches and chills, chest and back pain, and nausea. I was brought into the emergency department by my husband. Lab work and chest xray came back normal and I was informed the cause for symptoms was unknown but they may be related to receiving the flu vaccine and instructed to come back if my symptoms, especially if my neurological symptoms, increased or if I developed new symptoms and I was discharged home. I continued to run a low grade fever, and continued with numb/tingling feet, and generalized feeling of not feeling well. I woke up 12/20/19 at 8:00 am feeling numbness and tingling on the left side of my face and noticed I was drooling from the left side of my mouth. My family noted the left side of my face was drooping. Again my family brought me into Emergency department. The doctors there worked me up for stroke which was negative and it was determined I had recurrent Bells Palsy. I was given a prescription for Prednisone and Valacyclovir and discharged home. I later found out in people with a history of certain Bell's palsy the flu vaccine is not recommended and discovered cases of Bells Palsy after receiving the vaccine have been reported. I was never asked in the screening questions prior to receiving the flu vaccine if I had Bell's Palsy."

"This medically confirmed heath authority report (initial receipt 16-Dec-2015) concerns a 43 year old female patient. The patient had medical history of multinodular goitre. On 09-Nov-2015, the patient received intramuscular Afluria 2015/2016 (influenza virus vaccine polyvalent, batch number """"31601"""") for flu vaccination. On 10-Nov-2015, 2 days after vaccination, the patient developed oral mucosal eruption and oral pruritus. The patient developed fresh itchy erythema that speckled in the entire mouth and palate area. The events lasted for 8 days. The outcome was recovered on 17-Nov-2015. Reporter's Comments: PEI ref number: DE-PEI-PEI2015079145. Reporter's comments: 'measure: Recessan balm'. Sender's Comments: Company comments: Seriousness: Serious. Medically significant. Listedness: Unlisted. Assessment according to the CCSI for CSL Inactivated Influenza Virus Vaccine and the Afluria Product Information, both events are unlisted  Causality: Possible. Mucosal eruptions are often observed in allergic reactions to certain drugs such as antineoplastics and antibiotics. However, in the absence of such information, an atypical hypersensitivity reaction to the vaccine  may be considered plausible. This, together with the event's temporal proximity to the vaccination, makes ths the assessment plausible."""""

At this appointment, slight improvement although I do not notice it with my vision.  I wore the mono vision contact lenses and with my current vision in my left eye, I cannot continue to wear them because they do not help with my current vision and my job requires me to be at the computer.  I have an appointment this coming Monday to get a new prescription to help me with my current vision status to see better.  Hopefully, in a few months my vision will return and some of the darkness will be gone."
"Patient was given TDAP, FLU SHOT (IM) and VARICELLA (SQ) on the right arm and TWINRIX (IM) on the left arm. After patient was given vaccines, patient stated she was not feeling well. She stated her head was hurting and was having trouble swallowing and trouble breathing. I called the RN into my office and she asked the patient if she had ever had a reaction to a vaccine and patient stated no. Then RN gave patient Benadryl 20 ml and administered an EPIPEN at 2:05 PM , 911 was called immediately. Paramedics checked patient vitals and after patient vitals were stable she was asked to be transported to the hospital by ambulance, but patient denied. She stated she wanted her husband to take her to the hospital and she was advised to go to the nearest hospital as soon as possible, due to EPIPEN was administered."

He was seen here 3 days ago for an ER follow up visit. On day following shots he also had redness in the tongue and a 3 day loss of appetite. Child had a similar rash and had fever the day following his 1 yr vaccines. His fever following the his vaccines at his 1 yr visit, he received MMRV, and Hep A was not as high as this recent episode. The rash then started on the legs and spread to other areas. He also had lesions in his mouth and perioral area. He was seen in our office for that episode and diagnosed with Hand foot mouth disease. The rash seen after his recent 15 month visit is very much in keeping with a rash seen in Hand foot and mouth syndrome also."

Itchy, mild to moderate. Not painful, Not having fevers, at work, feels fine otherwise. No other trauma or irritation to the area noted by the patient. The rash is below the site of injection. Per outpatient follow-up note 9/21 no distress, temp 98.2, HR 72, (L) arm erythematous, macular rash of 8 cm with mild warmth, not tender or indurated full ROM in arm in all directions. Infection unlikely in s/o (-) fever. Patient advised to take CLARITIN, ZYRTEC, or BENADRYL for the itch and to contact if any fever, if rash spreads further or if patient feels unwell. No rash noted per outpatient physical exam on 10/8."

On 06-NOV-2015 at 10 AM, the patient was vaccinated with first dose of improperly stored dose of VARIVAX (Merck) lot # K005428, expiry date 15-APR-2016, in the right leg (thigh), at private doctor's office using private funds. This is one of three reports received from the same reporter. Additional information has been requested."

On 11/24/2015 I saw FNP and she changed the antibiotic (Levofloxacin) for sinusitis to AMOX TR-K CLV thinking it was the problem. I continued to have more and more pain and lack of arm movement. I have been treated three times a week since then.

"This spontaneous report was received from a 62 year old female patient, reporting on herself. The patient's pertinent medical history included breast cancer and knee replacement. It was reported that the patient had no drug reactions or allergies. On 29-SEP-2015, the patient was vaccinated with a dose of PNEUMOVAX 23 one shot, (lot #, expiration date, exact dose and route of administration were not reported). Concomitant therapies included influenza virus vaccine (unspecified) (reported as unspecified flu shot). On approximately 06-OCT-2015 (reported as about one week after receiving PNEUMOVAX 23), the patient developed hives. She sought medical attention, had an office visit and an unspecified steroid shot was given for the adverse event. No lab diagnostic studies were performed. No PQC (product quality complaint) was involved. The outcome of the event was reported as not recovered. At the time of report the patient continued to experience hives. The relatedness between the event and PNEUMOVAX 23 was not reported. Additional information has been requested."
"On 9/30, DOH was notified by an out-of-state health services company that a nurse had reused syringes for multiple persons earlier that day at an employee influenza vaccination clinic where the health services company had been contracted. The nurse contracted by the health services company brought three multiple-dose vials of vaccine that were intended for another event (and stored in her personal fridge without temp monitoring). The nurse reported using two syringes she found among her supplies to administer vaccine to 67 employees of the business. She reported wiping the syringes with alcohol and using a new needle for each of the 67 persons. Only 2 multiple dose vials of vaccine (10 doses/vial) were used for 67 adult participants. Participants were offered blood-borne pathogen testing (hep B, hep C, HIV), hepatitis B vaccine, and flu vaccine."

She reported wiping  the syringes with alcohol and using a new needle for each of the 67 persons. Only 2 multiple dose vials of vaccine (10 doses/vial) were used for 67 adult participants. Participants were offered blood borne pathogen testing (hep N, hep C, HIV), hepatitis B vaccine, and flu vaccine."
"On 9/30, agency was notified by an out-of-state health services company that a nurse had reused syringes for multiple persons earlier that day at an employee influenza vaccination clinic where the health services company had been contracted. The nurse contracted by the health services company brought three multiple-dose vials of vaccine that were intended for another event (and stored in her personal fridge without temp monitoring). The nurse reported using two syringes she found among her supplies to administer vaccine to 67 employees of the business. She reported wiping the syringes with alcohol and using the new needle for each of the 67 persons. Only 2 multiple dose vials of vaccine (10 doses/vial) were used for 67 adult participants. Participants were offered bloodborne pathogen testing (hep B, hep C, HIV), hepatitis B vaccine, and flu vaccine."

Received Flu shot 0.25 mg IM on 12/24/15 at 11 am. By evening patient started becoming clumsy. Next day daycare teacher noted clumsiness and tripping. Improved in 1 week.
"On 9/30, DOH was notified by an out-of-state health services company that a nurse had reused syringes for multiple persons earlier that day at an employee influenza vaccination clinic where the health services company had been contracted. "Employee c/o fever, itchiness, redness and swelling at injection site."
Day after injection painful arm. Pain continued and after 2 weeks physician ordered xray and prescribed prednisone. Pain spread. Orthopedic visit with cortisone injection and MRI. Dec. 18 MRI results-frozen shoulder. Starting physical therapy 1/5/16.

"Patient given high dose flu vaccine, pt is only 50 y/o."
"This was the very first 2 year child this season I was going to vaccinate for Flu shot. The whole family of 4 came in for the vaccines. I knew the other 3 would have the same vaccine and were given the FLUARIX. The father got the shot first, then the little girl but she was very scared, screaming in the room. While approaching her with the shot, she waved her hand in front of the needle and got a scratch kind of injury. This distracted me. I meant to check the dose of the shot before I gave the younger child but by this time he was confused and getting scared. So the parents and I decided we would give the shot to him quickly and then proceed with the documentation to prevent further agitation. I reached for FLUVIRIN, checked the expiry date, but forgot to check the age range, and gave the child the vaccine. I did not realize my mistake until the next day when I usually go over my day and think of how I could improve myself. I called my manager and let her know and following her advice called the CDC first to know of what to do. I did not have access to the child's information until 3 days and my manager was aware of that. By the next day I received feedback from CDC that no exaggerated adverse events were anticipated and no further vaccination was recommended. The next day I informed the mother who was very upset and angry as to why she wasn't informed as soon as I came to know. I explained to her that it was because my manager told me that the policy was to first check with CDC what their advice was and inform VAERS which was also done by myself. I think this happened partly because the label only had the age information in small letter unlike FLUARIX which had that in big fonts to draw my attention to it. Also last year we did have FLUZONE MDV which looks like FLUVIRIN, so that was in my mind."
"A Medical Assistant administered the over 3 prefilled syringe dose, instead of the 6-36 month prefilled dose syringe."
Patient was given the wrong vaccine at a mass community flu clinic.
Administered 0.5 mL of FLUZONE to 2 year 3 month old child instead of 0.25 mL.
Patient asked for a flu shot and indicated on the form at the pharmacy that he had never had a flu shot before. The injection was administered and patient left. When the technician went to post the information on the reporting site she found that the patient had received a flu shot two weeks before at another pharmacy.
Patient noticed a tender lymph node at her left clavicle the morning after her flu vaccination. She saw her doctor.  The doctor was uncertain whether or not the tender node was related to the vaccination.
"The nurse prepared FLUZONE vaccine for patient and another family member before interviewing patient. When patient and family member came into shot room, the nurse got distracted with talk about Tdap vaccine and forgot to ask patient about pregnancy status. The nurse proceeded to administer FLUZONE vaccine to patient. Just before finishing injecting the patient, the nurse got the sensation that the syringe was empty, but it was too late since she had already pushed the plunger to retract the needle. If that were the case, patient did not get the dose of FLUZONE. After patient left shot room, the nurse realized she should have prepared a dose of FLUVIRIN since the patient was pregnant."
Pt received KINRIX and PROQUAD along with flu shot. Pt already complained the KINRIX and PROQUAD series and did not need to receive vaccines. There was a mix up with the MICR and the error was found when documenting injections.

"3 immunizations on 11-12-15. Resulted in high fever and an emergency room visit on 11-14-15. Blood test results showed white cells in blood. PA and hospital report indicates it could be from the injections. Three (3) different vaccines administered, Thursday, November 12, 2015 about Noon-12:15 pm, by pharmacist. I reported this reaction by phone to my doctor (Monday, Nov. 16?), and also a pharmacist (19th) where the injections were given. All 3 injections were given in my left arm/shoulder because I have a torn rotator cuff on my right shoulder. The shingles vaccine was injected under the skin under my upper left arm and the other 2 injections were given in the top of my shoulder. As I expected, my left shoulder was tender to the touch, and very uncomfortable when leaning on it, similar to past immunizations. I report this because I had to go to the emergency room where white cells/bacteria were found in my blood. I was told there by the PA that it was probably introduced with the vaccine injections. On 11-12-15 I had a 10:00 a.m. appointment with Dr. at the local clinic, not for an illness, but for a routine, 6-month appointment, including a routine blood test. Everything was fine. I talked with Dr. about having the 3 immunizations that another clinic had recommended when I was there Sept. 22. Both Dr. and a pharmacist said it shouldn't be a problem to have all three vaccines at one time. She contacted the local pharmacy. I had no problems until about 10:50 p.m. that night. I felt intermittent chills, and after I was in bed, my body started sharking uncontrollably for what seemed like a long time, until I went to sleep. The next morning, Friday the 13th, my temperature was about 100 degrees, and it kept rising all day. I had a terrible headache, couldn't think clearly and was unable to get out of bed except to go to the bathroom. I did not eat all day, and when I drank a glass of skim milk, it curdled and came up. After I woke up Saturday, all morning my temperature varied from 102 degrees to over 103 degrees (103.7 degrees at one point). In mid-morning when my daughter phoned, she told me that I wasn't making any sense. When I didn't recognize my husband, he took me over to our local hospital to the emergency room. They did a variety of tests (blood test, urine, chest x-ray), and the PA said there were white cells in my blood, saying it was bacteria most likely."
